definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: She's had three husbands and I'll be an old maid.
sentences.chinese: 她有过叁个丈夫，而我要变成一个老处女了。

sentences.english: The poor good old woman was a spinster.
sentences.chinese: 那可怜慈祥的妇人是个老处女。

sentences.english: Two prim spinsters are sitting together quietly.
sentences.chinese: 两个一本正经的老处女安静地坐在一起。

sentences.english: In a neat's tongue dried and a maid not vendible.
sentences.chinese: 干牛舌和没人要的老处女。

sentences.english: Two middle-aged spinsters, vacationing at a rustic inn.
sentences.chinese: 两个中年的老处女，在一个乡下的客栈渡假时。

sentences.english: She had stiffened into a pronounced spinsterhood .
sentences.chinese: 她古板得成了十足的老处女。

definition: older female/woman of mature years (Japanese loanword)
"leftover woman" (successful career woman who has remained single)
to stay at home while one's husband is away/grass widow
middle-aged but still attractive woman/lady of a certain age
sex fiend/molester/sex attacker/sex demon (a spirit that enters people's souls and makes them desire sex)
